Radial Gauge

The RadialGauge PHP class is a server-side wrapper for the Kendo UI DataViz RadialGauge widget.

Getting Started

Here is how to configure a simple Kendo UI RadialGauge:

  1. Follow the steps from the introduction - include the autoloader, JavaScript and CSS files.

  2. Add a radial gauge:

    $gauge = new \Kendo\Dataviz\UI\RadialGauge('gauge');
$gauge->pointer(array('value' => 10))
      ->scale(array('min' => 0, 'max' => 100));

  3. Output the chart by echo-ing the result of the render method.

     echo $gauge->render();

Accessing an Existing Radial Gauge

You can reference an existing RadialGauge instance via jQuery.data(). Once a reference has been established, you can use the API to control its behavior.

Accessing an existing RadialGauge instance

    // Put this after your Kendo RadialGauge for PHP render() call
    <script>
    $(function() {
        // Notice that the Name() of the radialGauge is used to get its client-side instance
        var gauge = $("#radialGauge").data("kendoRadialGauge");
        gauge.value(20);
    });
    </script>
